intro: Berberis × laxiflora var. langeana, commonly known as the Langeana barberry, is a hybrid shrub native to the eastern United States. It features compound leaves with three to five elliptical leaflets, which are dark green and glossy on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in early spring, followed by red, berry-like fruits that are edible but often tart. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile ornamental plant. Its compact growth habit and seasonal color changes make it popular in gardens and landscapes.
